components.name: Base Plate
manual: Use the provided files to cut the base boards out of 3mm HDF sheets (each min. 520x520) using a laser or a CNC machine
Use the provided file to cut a dampening layer from 3mm synthetic felt (min. 500x500mm)
Cut the square steel bar to length, deburr and chamfer the edges
Stack the synthetic felt as the first layer and then the base boards according to their numbering
Insert the square steel bars into the designated slots
Join the stack by using 13 screws, the 3D printed spacers will help to hold the felt in position. The nuts can be countersunk in the topmost board

components.name: Motor Tower
Motor Mount
Parts
components.desc: Lasercut parts made from 3mm acrylic sheets

components.name: Felt
components.desc: Lasercut suspension made from 3mm synthetic felt

components.name: Endstop
Holder
components.desc: 3D printed part that mounts the endstop

components.name: Wire
components.desc: 2-strand wire with jumper connector on one end

manual: Print Holder using any material that is more heat resistant than PLA. Use fine print settings, no support is needed.
Solder wire to tactile switch's closing connectors
Add switch to inner side of 3D printed part
Add spring-loaded mechanism comprising the spring, the screw and Nut 1
Add Nut 2 to dedicated slot on the outside of the holder

components.name: Roll
Roll
components.desc: 3D printed roll, use heat resistant ABS

components.name: Fishing Line
components.desc: 4m of non-elastic fishing line (e.g. braided, not monofil) or similar thin, strong material that is barely visible

components.name: Jewelry Hook
components.desc: Tiny hook typically used for jewelry like nacklaces

manual: Print the roll from heat-resistant material (>100Â°C glass transition temperatures). Quality does not matter (e.g. 0.3mm layer height), but it should tightly fit on motor shaft.
Add nut and screw to print
Add an adjustable grip hitch to one end of the line.
Add the jewelry hook to the other end with a double davy knot.
Once the Motor Tower is assembled, thread the loop through the lower aligner, the other motor modules, around the rod, through the hole in the roll and fasten it onto the motor shaft.
Lasercut all the required parts, prepare the EndStop and the Roll.
Glue the acrylic parts using Dichloromethane
(Braid motor wires, add connectors to the motor wires.)
Srew suspension felt to motor front plate using four Screw 1.
Screw suspension to Motor Mount using four Screw 2, four nuts, and four damper rings.
Add Roll to motor's shaft.
Add EndStop and Rod to the Motor Mount and lock it off using Screw 3.

components.name: Controller Mount
Parts
components.desc: Lasercut parts made from 3mm acrylic sheets

components.name: Ethernet Shield
components.desc: Ethernet Shield for Arduino Uno / Mega with W5100 Ethernet Chip

components.name: Intermediate PCB
components.desc: Custom PCB to reroute CNC shield connections (CNC and Ethernet Shield use same I/O ports)

components.name: CNC Shield
components.desc: CNC Shield v3 by protoneer

components.name: Wire
components.desc: Power wires to supply Arduino Uno and CNC Shield with 12V power (<20AWG)

manual: Lasercut all the required parts. Glue them using Dichloromethane.
Create stack from the shields (bottom to top): Arduino Uno, Ethernet Shield, Custom PCB, CNC Shield.
Prepare power supply wires with a length of 500mm each and crimps on one end.Add the Ethernet Cable.
Fix Arduino to mount using four screws and four nuts, create some distance by stacking two nuts between the Arduino and the acrylic pieces on each screw.

components.name: Spacer 1
components.desc: Made from plastic tubing, inner diameter: 5mm, length: 60mm

components.name: Spacer 2
components.desc: Made from plastic tubing, inner diameter: 5mm, length: 30mm

components.name: Spacer 3
components.desc: Made from plastic tubing, inner diameter: 5mm, length: 100mm

components.name: Damper Rings
components.desc: Optional damper rings made from 3mm synthetic felt

manual: Prepare Motor Modules, Controller Module, cut rods to length, cut spacers to length.
Begin stacking the components by adding cover nuts to one end of all rods.
Now add the Aligner connecting the four rods
Add one damper, one Spacer 1, one damper.
Add one motor module.
Repeat the two previous steps three times. Take care that each motor module needs to be rotated 90 degrees clockwise to the previous one.
Add one damper, one Spacer 2, one damper.
Add the Controller Module.
Add one damper, one Spacer 3, one damper.
Condense the stack as far as possible. The four remaining cover nuts will be needed to combine the individual towers once they are stacked inside the Actuation Unit.

components.name: Control Unit
Distributer Block
components.desc: Quick Release Distributer Blocks, min. 1 GND, min. 4x +

components.name: Clamps
components.desc: 3D printed clamps to mount Distributer Blocks to aluminum profile

components.name: Controller
Raspberry Pi 4 B
components.desc: Central controller to run NodeJS server

manual: Connect temperature sensor and push buttons to Raspberry Pi I/O ports
Connect Raspberry Pi with power and Ethernet
Install Raspbian OS on Raspberry Pi, add VS Code, pull repo, npm install, run controller.js
Mount the backplate to the back of the actuation unit with M3 screws and slot nuts.
Attach the Controller, the Network Switch, and the Router with mounts, screws, or zip ties.
Mount the Distributer blocks to the upper slot with the provided mounts.

components.name: Power Connector
components.desc: XT60 power connector male and female

components.name: Connector
components.desc: Lasercut connectors made from 3mm acrylic sheets

components.name: Frame
Heavy Duty Feet
components.desc: Feet with mounting plate for aluminum extrusions

components.name: Heavy Duty Roll
components.desc: Rolls with mounting plate for aluminum extrusions

manual: Add M8 core threads to two 'Profile 4' on one end and to one 'Profile 4' on both ends which are used to make the rectangle holding the Actuation Unit.
Connect all aluminum profiles with given joints. Work from the bottom to the top.
The bulky frame can easily be transported on the back rolls, simply remove the Actuation Unit and the Display Element Unit.

components.name: Display Element
LED
components.desc: SK6812 LED on an individual chip

manual: Strip the ends of the wire. Solder one end to LED. Crimp other end.
Prepare epoxy resin and thorougly mix it with white epoxy. Take care of color consistency, e.g., 5 drops of ink per 40g epoxy.
Use a (spherical) mold, put LED through upper hole, pour epoxy on top. Make sure to add more epoxy as it shrinks during reaction.

components.name: Case
manual: Create the separator unit by glueing the individual parts in a regular gridlike structure.
Stack the Top Cover in the order as given. Glue the retraction mechanism to its underside.Add the felt on top.
The cables of each element needs to be wound around the Luff Tackle mechanism, and then runs within channels in the Top Cover to the back.
Insert each counterweight into its designated slot in the separator unit, align both properly.
Place it on the sturdy base board and in the bottom most position of the frame.

components.name: Luff Tackle Mechanism
Disks
components.desc: Lasercut parts from 3mm HDF to be glued into 3 different rolls

components.name: Bearing
components.desc: Round Spacer, 15mm length, 8mm diameter, M5 threads on both sides

manual: Glue the disks as stacks of 4 to create 3 rolls with 20/35mm, 30/45mm, 40/55mm diameter.
Screw the biggest and smallest rolls in between the lower sled, using Screw 1, Washer 1, Bearing.
Mount the countweight to the sled using Screw 2, Nut 2.
Proceed similarly with the upper upper mount.

components.name: Controller
PCB
components.desc: Custom PCB for connecting all LEDs

components.name: Jumper
components.desc: 4x jumper to connect the crimped cables to

components.name: Other components
components.desc: Other electrical components needs for PCB

manual: Solder all components onto PCB.
Connect all LED cables
Connect to power, programm ESP.

components.name: Base Board
components.desc: Beech board 495x540x10mm supporting the whole unit
